tags.name: sms/send
tags.description:
This service allows the user to send SMS to one or more terminals (phones or any SMS-enabled device) from their application.

 SMS send service supports only POST HTTP requests. This is used when sending SMS to a mobile phone from an application.

 An application wishing to initiate an MT SMS message should use this operation type.

tags.name: sms/receive
tags.description: This service retrieves the SMS sent to the web application. Receive service returns only a list of SMS messages received since the previous invocation of the method.

tags.name: sms/report
tags.description: When performing a SendSms Operation if an application has requested for a Delivery Response message from the Message Centre, then TAP will initiate the Delivery Report service to hand over the Delivery Response message to the application. The messageId should be used to match the MT response with the Delivery Report.

tags.name: ussd/send
tags.description: This service is used when sending USSD messages to a mobile phone from an application.USSD send service supports only POST HTTP requests.

tags.name: ussd/receive
tags.description:
This service allows TAP to deliver MO messages to the application using HTTP – based API. The flow of messages is initiated by a MO request sent to an application,TAP will deliver the message to the application as an acknowledgement. Hence it could be either request-response exchange or a request-exception exchange.

 Receive USSD request is a MO message which will be sent to the application through Applink as a delivery request.

tags.name: caas/chargingNotification
tags.description: Charging notification is returned to the developer application upon a charging attempt. It will denote whether the charging is successful or not. Charging notification is returned to the endpoint you have configured under the 'charging notification URL' section in CaaS API when creating the application

tags.name: caas/queryBalance2
tags.description: This service retrieves the account balance and related information of a given subscriber MSISDN. Account information comprises of Account type (Pre paid or Post paid) and Account’s status (Activate or Disable).

tags.name: caas/directDebit
tags.description: This service charges a specific amount from a subscriber’s account.

tags.name: caas/queryBalance
tags.description: This service charges a specific amount from a subscriber’s account.

tags.name: caas/otpGeneration
tags.description: This service is used by the developer to initiate a one time charging for the subscriber on his/her mobile account. Upon the request, Applink will generate and send an OTP to the subscriber's MSISDN. This OTP must be entered by the subscriber into the mobile/web application to authorize the one time charge.

tags.name: caas/otpVerify
tags.description: This service is used by the developer to verify an OTP entered by a subscriber into the application. Upon a successful verification, one time charging will be deducted from the subscriber's mobile account.

tags.name: subscription/userSubscription
tags.description: This service handles user subscription process(subscription/unsubscription)

tags.name: subscription/baseSize
tags.description: This service returns the number of registered subscribers

tags.name: subscription/notify
tags.description: This service sends notifications to the users

tags.name: otp/request
tags.description: This service is used by the developer to request an OTP for a subscriber's MSISDN. Upon the request, an OTP will be generated and sent to the subscriber's MSISDN. This OTP must be entered by the subscriber into the mobile/web application to activate a subscription.

tags.name: otp/verify
tags.description: This service is used by the developer to verify an OTP entered by a subscriber into the application. Upon a successful verification the subscription process of AppLink will be activated. Note: The OTP dispatched to the subscriber by triggering this API is only valid for 5 minutes

version.description:
API version shall be numbered as 1.0, 2.0 etc.

If version is specified in the request, same version must be sent in the response.

If version is not specified in the request, the latest version will be specified in the response.

applicationId.description:
Used to identify the application. This is a unique identifier generated while provisioning an application. 

Only a single value can be sent per request.

password.description: This API key will be sent to your registered email address on the platform upon application approval.

message.description:
Content of the message that needs to be sent.

Messages over the limit shall be broken up by the platform before sending

destinationAddresses.description:
List of destination addresses should be telephone numbers.(tel - for MSISDN).

tel:+8801975355595.

Address can also have the value - tel: all

 which will in return be a message to the subscribed base of the application 

at least one should be specified

Note : tel might be a masked number depending on the type of application

sourceAddress.description:
Address of the source.

sourceAddress: tel:+8801975355595

 at least one will be specified

deliveryStatusRequest.description:
Indicates the need of a Delivery Status Report for the message.

 0 - Delivery Report not required

1 - Delivery Report Required

encoding.description:
Encoding scheme used in the message

If not specified taken as Text

If the encoding type is “Binary” then the message content will be represented as hex encoded.

0 - Text

240 - Flash SMS

245 - Binary SMS

binaryHeader.description: For advanced type of messages where the binary header shall be sent from the application

destinationResponses.description: The list of responses for the full list of addresses.It will be a collection with individual entry for each element in the address list of the request.address,timeStamp - Processed Time stamp,messageId - Message Identifier,statusCode - Status Code,statusDetail – Status detail

statusCode.description: The status code for the entire request

statusDetail.description:
The status detail for the entire request

 S1000  - Process completed successfully for all the available destination numbers.

 E1303  - IP address from which this request originated is not provisioned to send request to application <application-id>. Please use a provisioned system to send request or contact system admin to provision the new IP. E1308  - Permanent charging error due to <specify_reason E.g., Insufficient Balance>.

 E1309  - Requested SMS service is not allowed for this application. Please check the issue with mSpace system administrator.

 E1311  - Mobile terminated SMS messages are not enabled. Check your NCS configuration in provisioning.

 E1312  - Request is Invalid. <specify_the_reason> Refer the TAP NBL API Developer Guide for the mandatory fields and correct format of the request.

 E1313  - Authentication failed. No such active application with applicationId <application-id>, or no active service provider or the given password in the request is invalid.

 E1315  - Cannot find the requested service SMS or it is not active.

 E1317  - < MSISDN > in request is invalid or not allowed.

 E1318  - Transaction limit per second has exceeded. Please throttle requests not to exceed the transaction limit. Contact TAP admin to increase the traffic limit.

 E1319  - Transaction limit for today has exceeded. Please try again tomorrow or contact TAP admin to increase the transaction per day limit.

 E1325  - Format of the address is invalid. Expected format is tel:94711211212.

 E1331  - < sourceAddress > is not allowed. Please use one of the values configured in alias configuration in the SLAs or send the request without < sourceAddres s>, so mSpace will use the default source address to send the message to subscriber.

 E1334  - SMS sent to < application name > application could not be processed as the message length is too long. Maximum message length allowed is < specify_max_limit >.

 E1335  - SMS sent to < application name > application could not be processed as the advertisement message length is too long. Maximum message length allowed for advertisements is < specify_max_adv_limit >.

 E1341  - Request failed. Errors occurred while sending the request for all the destinations.

 E1342  - MSISDN is black listed. Not authorized to use the application <application_name>.

 E1343  - MSISDN is not white listed. Only white list numbers are allowed to send messages at this state.

 E1601  - System experienced an unexpected error.

 E1603  - Temporary System Error occurred while delivering your request

version.description:
API version shall be numbered as 1.0, 2.0 etc.

If version is specified in the request, same version must be sent in the response.

If version is not specified in the request, the latest version will be specified in the response.

requestId.description: Uniquely identifies a request within TAP

destinationResponses.description:
The list of responses for the full list of addresses

It will be a collection with individual entry for each element in the address list of the request.

 -Address

 - timeStamp - Processed Time stamp

 - messageId - Message Identifier

 - statusCode - Status Code

 - statusDetail – Status detail

statusCode.description: The status code for the entire request

statusDetail.description:
Description of the status for the entire request.

 S1000  - Process completed successfully for all the available destination numbers.

 E1303  - IP address from which this request originated is not provisioned to send requests to application <application-id>. Please use a provisioned system to send requests or contact system admin to provision the new IP.

 E1308  - Permanent charging error due to <specify_reason E.g., Insufficient Balance>.

 E1309  - Requested SMS service is not allowed for this application. Please check the issue with mSpace system administrator.

 E1311  - Mobile terminated SMS messages are not enabled. Check your NCS configuration in provisioning.

 E1312  - Request is invalid. <specify_the_reason> Refer the TAP NBL API Developer Guide for the mandatory fields and correct format of the request.

 E1315  - Cannot find the requested service SMS or it is not active.

 E1317  - < MSISDN > in request is invalid or not allowed.

 E1318  - Transaction limit per second has exceeded. Please throttle requests not to exceed the transaction limit. Contact TAP admin to increase the traffic limit.

 E1325  - Format of the address is invalid. Expected format is tel:94711211212.

 E1331  - < sourceAddress > is not allowed. Please use one of the values configured in alias configuration in the SLAs or send the request without < sourceAddress>, so mSpace will use the default source address to send the message to subscriber.

 E1335  - SMS sent to < application name > application could not be processed as the advertisement message length is too long. Maximum message length allowed for advertisements is < specify_max_adv_limit >.

 E1341  - Request failed.An error occurred while sending the request for all the destinations.

 E1342  - MSISDN is black listed. Not authorized to use the application <application_name>.

 E1343  - MSISDN is not white listed. Only white listed numbers are allowed to send messages at this state.

 E1601  - System experienced an unexpected error.

 E1603  - Temporary system error occurred while delivering your request

timeStamp.description:
The timestamp sent from the SMS.
"yyMMddHHmm"
yy – last two digits of the year (00-99)
MM – month (01-12)
dd – day (01-31)
HH – hour (00-23)
mm- minute (00-59)

requestId.description: Uniquely identifies a request within TAP

deliveryStatus.description: Enum from TAP to Application:DELIVERED, EXPIRED, DELETED,UNDELIVERABLE, ACCEPTED,UNKNOWN, REJECTED

version.description:
API version shall be numbered as 1.0, 2.0 etc.

If version is specified in the request, same version must be sent in the response.

If version is not specified in the request, the latest version will be specified in the response.

applicationId.description:
Used to identify the application. This is a unique identifier generated while provisioning an application. 

Only a single value can be sent per request.

message.example:
1. Press One
 2. Press two
 3. Press three
 4. Exit
message.description: Content of the message sent by the application

password.description: This API key will be sent to your registered email address on the platform upon application approval.

sessionId.description: Unique number that USSD Gateway assigns to the application for the duration of the session. This number will be maintained in all the messages throughout a single session.

ussdOperation.description:
USSD operation

 mo-cont:TAP to assign for and USSD message originated from subscriber, that comes after a init

nmt-init: App to assign when a USSD session is initiated by an application

mt-cont: App to assign for any USSD message originated from application, that comes after a init

mt-fin: App to assign when session ends in final message

Data type will be string where the operation name itself will be used in the parameter value.

destinationAddress.description:
Destination address should be a telephone number (tel - for MSISDN)

Note : tel might be a masked number depending on the type of application

encoding.description:
Encoding scheme used in the message 

440 - Plain ASCII characters

applicationId.description:
Used to identify the application. This is a unique identifier generated while provisioning an application. 

Only a single value can be sent per request.

password.description: This API key will be sent to your registered email address on the platform upon application approval.

subscriberId.description:
This can be the MSISDN or the username of the subscriber whose account balance is being queried.

 Note: tel might be a masked number depending on the type of the application

Only a single value can be sent per request.

paymentInstrumentName.description:
The name of the payment instrument.

Only a single value can be sent per request.

accountId.description:
The account of the payment instrument.

Only a single value can be sent per request.

currency.description:
Currency unit of the amount.

Only a single value can be sent per request.

Only ‘BDT’ is allowed.

accountType.description:
Account type of the subscriber ID.
E.g. Prepaid/Post paid for GSM domain.

 Only a single set of elements can be sent per request

accountStatus.description: Account status of the subscriber ID.Only a single set of elements can be sent per request

statusCode.description: The status code for the entire request

statusDetail.description:
Description of the status for the entire request.

 S1000  - Process completed successfully for all the available destination numbers.

 E1303  - IP address from which this request originated is not provisioned to send requests to application <application-id>. Please use a provisioned system to send requests or contact system admin to provision the new IP.

 E1319  - Transaction limit for today has exceeded. Please try again tomorrow or contact TAP admin to increase the transaction per day limit.

 E1326  - Insufficient balance.

 E1328  - Charging operation {operation} not allowed. Please check the NCS configuration.

 E1337  - Duplicate request.

 E1343  - MSISDN is not white listed. Only white list numbers are allowed to send messages at this state.

 E1601  - System experienced an unexpected error.

 E1602  - Message delivery failed. Please retry

 E1603  - Temporary system error occurred while delivering your request

chargeableBalance.description:
Available chargeable balance of the subscriber.

 Refers to either remaining account balance (prepaid user) or the difference between credit limit and outstanding bill (postpaid user).

 rounded up to two decimal points

applicationId.description:
Used to identify the application. This is a unique identifier generated while provisioning an application. 

Only a single value can be sent per request.

password.description: This API key will be sent to your registered email address on the platform upon application approval.

externalTrxId.description: This is the transaction ID generated by the application to map the request with the response. This is needed to provide information when there are inquiries related to a transaction. Only a single value can be sent per request.

amount.description: Amount to be reserved for charging. Only a single value can be sent per request.

paymentInstrumentName.description: The name of the payment instrument. Only a single value can be sent per request.

subscriberId.description: This is the MSISDN of the subscriber to be charged. This is a unique identifier. Eg: tel: 8801975355595 Note: This can be a masked number depending on the type of the application. Only a single value can be sent per request.

Currency.description: Currency unit of the amount. Only a single value can be sent per request. Only ‘BDT’ is allowed.

timeStamp.description: The time that the request was sent

externalTrxId.description: This is the transaction ID generated by the application to map the request with the response. Only a single value can be sent per request.

statusDetail.example: Request successfully proceed. OTP will send to user.
statusDetail.description: Detailed description explaining the status of the entire request

requestCorrelator.description: The unique identifier used internally within the system to identify the transaction

internalTrxId.description: The transaction ID generated by the service provider which can be used to track the transaction

statusCode.description: This code will show the status of the request. If the code starts with, P- Partial E-Error S-Success

applicationId.description:
Used to identify the application. This is a unique identifier generated while provisioning an application. 

Only a single value can be sent per request.

password.description: This API key will be sent to your registered email address on the platform upon application approval.

referenceNo.description: The value returned for parameter 'requestCorrelator' in the response of the CaaS OTP generation request must be used here as the reference of the transaction

otp.description: Specify the OTP entered by the subscriber on the developer application.

sourceAddress.description: Source Address shows the MSISDN that requested the OTP

chargingNotificatio.type: There is no request to be triggered in order to obtain this charging notification. It will be automatically returned as a callback to the initial charging request once the transaction is completed within the system.

timeStamp.description: The time which the request was sent

TotalAmount.description: Amount deducted from the subscriber as the one time charge

externalTrxId.description: This is the transaction ID generated by the application to map the request with the response. This is needed to provide information when there are inquiries related to a transaction. Only a single value can be sent per request.

balanceDue.description: The amount that is due will be displayed if there is any, if not it will show 0

statusDetail.example: Request was Successfully processed, Due amount fully paid.
statusDetail.description: Detailed description explaining the status of the entire request

currency.description: Currency unit of the amount. Only a single value can be sent per request. Only ‘BDT’ is allowed.

version.description:
API version shall be numbered as 1.0, 2.0 etc.

 If version is specified in the request, same version must be sent in the response.

 If version is not specified in the request, the latest version will be specified in the response.

internalTrxId.description: The unique identifier used to track the request at the developer application end

paidAmount.description: The amount that is paid by the subscriber.

referenceId.description: The unique reference used to identify the transaction within the system

statusCode.description: This code will show the status of the request, if the Code starts with a: P- Partial E-Error S-Success

Used to identify the application. This is a unique identifier generated while provisioning an application. 

Only a single value can be sent per request.

 Note: tel might be a masked number depending on the type of the application

API version shall be numbered as 1.0, 2.0 etc.

If version is specified in the request, same version must be sent in the response.

If version is not specified in the request, the latest version will be specified in the response.

Only a single value can be sent per request.

statusCode.description: The status code for the entire request.

statusDetail.description: Description of the status for the entire request.

applicationId.description:
Used to identify the application. This is a unique identifier generated while provisioning an application. 

Only a single value can be sent per request.

password.description: This API key will be sent to your registered email address on the platform upon application approval.

subscriberIds.description:
MSISDNs of the list of subscribers. Eg: [tel: 8801973579363, tel:8801973579363]

 If the application accepts masked numbers, list of

 masked numbers must be communicated in this parameter

 List can contain maximum of 10 MSISDNs per request

subscriberId.description:
MSISDN of the subscriber.

 If the application accepts masked numbers, 

 list of masked numbers must be communicated in this parameter

 THIS IS A MANDATORY FILED

subscriptionStatus.description:
Status of the subscription 

 Eg: INITIAL,

 REG_PENDING, TRIAL, REGISTERED,

 UNREGISTERED and TEMPORARY_BLOCKED

lastChargedDate.description:
The successful last charged date of the subscriber

 in the format of YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

lastChargedAmount.description:
The successful last charged amount for the

 subscriber with the currency code

numberType.description: Denotes whether the subscriber is prepaid or postpaid

statusCode.description:
Success or error code for each subscriber and for

 the entire request

version.description:
API version shall be numbered as 1.0, 2.0 etc.

 If version is specified in the request, same version must be sent in the response.

 If version is not specified in the request, the latest version will be specified in the response.

statusCode.description: The status code for the entire request

statusDetail.description:
Below table provides information on different subscription statuses returned 

 by the getSubscriptionChargingInfo service.

 INITIAL - Subscription request is sent to the system. The subscription request

 might not be completed may be due to a system error. Not even the charging

 call is made during this instance.

 Parameters returns in response : subscriberId,subscriptionStatus,

 numberType,statusCode,statusDetail

 

 REG_PENDING - Subscription request is made and charging request is also sent

 but charging is not yet success.(Eg: Charging response not yet received from the IN,

 Insufficient balance)

 Parameters returns in response : subscriberId,subscriptionStatus,

 numberType,statusCode,statusDetail

 TRIAL - Subscription request is made and the platform allows subscribers to use

 the service without charging as they have a free trial period enabled.

 Parameters returns in response : subscriberId,subscriptionStatus,

 numberType,statusCode,statusDetail

 REGISTERED - Subscription request is made, charging is successful and the

 subscriber can receive the service.If the application registered to is a free

 application lastChargedDate to be omitted and lastChargedAmount to be sent as

 0.00 LKR

 Parameters returns in response : subscriberId,subscriptionStatus,

 lastChargedDate,lastChargedAmount,numberType,statusCode,statusDetail

 UNREGISTERED - Subscription request is made and unsubscription is also

 done by the subscriber for the particular service.If the application unregistered

 from is a free application lastChargedDate to be omitted and lastChargedAmount to be

 sent as 0.00 LKR

 Parameters returns in response : subscriberId,subscriptionStatus, lastChargedDate,lastChargedAmount,numberType,statusCode,statusDetail

 TEMPORARY_BLOCKED - Subscription request is made initial charging was

 also successful and was in the registered status once but

 recursive charging has failed

 (Eg: Due to insufficient balance) and service is temporarily blocked for this subscriber

 If the application registered to is a free

 application lastChargedDate to be omitted and lastChargedAmount to be sent as 0.00 LKR

 Parameters returns in response : subscriberId,subscriptionStatus,lastChargedDate,lastChargedAmount,

 numberType,statusCode,statusDetail

 The status detail for the entire request

 S1000  - Process completed successfully for all the available destination numbers.

 E1303  - IP address from which this request originated is not provisioned to send request to application <application-id>. Please use a provisioned system to send request or contact system admin to provision the new IP.

 E1312  - Request is Invalid. <specify_the_reason> Refer the TAP NBL API Developer Guide for the mandatory fields and correct format of the request.

 E1313  - Authentication failed. No such active application with applicationId <application-id>, or no active service provider or the given password in the request is invalid.

 E1317  - < MSISDN > in request is invalid or not allowed.

 E1325  - Format of the address is invalid. Expected format is tel: 94712342345.

 E1601  - System experienced an unexpected error.

 E1603  - Temporary System Error occurred while delivering your request

timeStamp.description:
The timestamp sent from the SMS.
"yyMMddHHmm"
yy – last two digits of the year (00-99)
MM – month (01-12)
dd – day (01-31)
HH – hour (00-23)
mm- minute (00-59)

 S1000 - Successfully send OTP challenge to [msisdn/sender ID]

 E1301 - Requested ApplicationID is not allowed within the System for operator.

 E1312 - Invalid request - Missing mandatory field 

 E1313 - Authentication failure. There is no active application, or no active service provider or given password in the request is invalid.

 E1603 – Temporary system error occurred while delivering your request

 E1856 – Invalid Request

subscriberId.description:
Masked mobile number of the subscriber.

 In the format: "tel:8801416177301" or In the format of:
 tel:sdfasdfasdfwqerqwtgfgsafgasfgasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfas

Plain number or masked number to be used in the API will be depending on whether your application setting is enabled for plain number usage or masked number usage
